Summary Note:
The RM was introduced to Eleonora Gaia Lotti at a corporate retreat in Rome. They participated in team-building activities and developed a strong rapport, which eventually led to a successful business partnership.
Eleonora Gaia Lotti is a 52 year old Operations Manager from Italy. She has a diverse background, having worked in various capacities and gained extensive knowledge in the field.
Looking for a private bank with a deep understanding of wealth management, she joined Julius Baer for its expertise.
Family Background: Eleonora Gaia Lotti is currently widowed. She has 3 kids called Emma, Russo and Emanuela.
Education Background:
Eleonora graduated from Liceo Musicale Arrigo Boito Parma in 1990.
Eleonora earned her degree from IMT Institute for Advanced Studies Lucca in 1997.
She also pursued further higher education at University of Turin, graduating in 1999.
Occupation History:
Eleonora Gaia Lotti is a 52 year old Operations Manager from Italy.
Eleonora Gaia Lotti launched her career as a Drilling Engineer at ERGA S.p.A., where she gained valuable experience from 1996 to 1999.
After gaining experience, she took on the role of Reservoir Engineer at Edison S.p.A. in 2001, further expanding her skill set.
At Edison S.p.A., she worked as a Operations Manager from 2006 till now, focusing on strategic initiatives and team collaboration.
Wealth Summary:
While working, she saved 510000 EUR, which she used to build a diversified investment portfolio.
She owns house in Taranto, where she resides. It is worth 1009000 EUR.

In addition to her primary residence, she owns townhouse in Venice worth 1022000 EUR.

On top of that she inherited a beautiful townhouse in Modena, which could be used as a weekend getaway. It is valued at 1410000 EUR.
She inherited 690000 EUR from her grandmother, a well-known Oil and Gas Executive, in 2012, allowing her to expand her investment portfolio.
Client Summary: The RM knows the client very well and is a good friend of the entire family.
